# Roleplay Rule 2 - Escalation is expected
- You are expected to be able to properly escalate and descalate situations. - This means you should use a proper "build-up" when resolving conflict. - Try to start with words by talking people out of their actions, move to warnings, only after those are exhausted should you use violence. - If someone skips steps, you are welcome to do the same. - Antagonists do not have to escalate and can skip right to murder. - Not every fight has to go to the death, if someone is trying to run away it isnt a bad idea to let them. - Bring people you kill as non-antagonist to medbay for healing unless you have VERY good reason not to.
## Examples
### [bold] Permitted [/bold]
- Killing someone who breaks into your department after warning and threatening them several times. - Killing someone who is trying to kill you. - Fighting someone who is trying to fight you. - Subduing someone who is attacking nearby people. - Turning a blind eye to bad things happening.
### [bold] Not Permitted [/bold]
- Killing / Beating someone immediately after they break into your department. - Killing / Beating someone for annoying you. - Killing / Beating someone for stealing from you (yell at them first goddamn.)
